member.name: ITfRange.AdjustForInsert
member.summary: The ITfRange.AdjustForInsert method expands or contracts a range of text to adjust for text insertion.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Character count of the inserted text. This count is used in a futurecall to . If the character count is unknown, 0 can be used.
Pointer to a flag that indicates whether the context owner will accept (TRUE) or reject (FALSE) the insertion.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The application was unable to replace the selection.
The value in the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.Clone
member.summary: The ITfRange.Clone method duplicates this range of text.
member.param: Pointer to a new range object that references this range.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The method was unable to generate a pointer to the new range.

member.name: ITfRange.Collapse
member.summary: The ITfRange.Collapse method clears the range of text by moving its start anchor and end anchor to the same position.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .

param.name: aPos
param.para: enumeration that describes how to collapse the range.

listheader.description: The end anchor is moved to the location of the start anchor.
The start anchor is moved to the location of the end anchor.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The object does not support the interface, or a new range cannot be created.
The cookie in ec is invalid, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.CompareEnd
member.summary: The ITfRange.CompareEnd method compares the end anchor position of this range of text to an anchor in another range.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Pointer to a specified range in which an anchor is to be compared with this range end anchor.

param.name: aPos
param.para: Enumeration element that indicates which anchor of the specified pWith range to compare with this range end anchor.

listheader.description: Compare this range end anchor with the specified range start anchor.
Compare this range end anchor with the specified range end anchor.

param.name: plResult
param.para: Pointer to the result of the comparison between this range end anchor and the anchor of the specified pWith range.

listheader.description: This end anchor is behind the anchor of the specified range (position of this end anchor < position of the anchor of the specified range).
This end anchor is at the same position as the anchor of the specified range.
This end anchor is ahead of the anchor of the specified range (position of this end anchor > position of the anchor of the specified range).

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.CompareStart
member.summary: The ITfRange.CompareStart method compares the start anchor position of this range of text to an anchor in another range.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Pointer to a specified range in which an anchor is to be compared to this range start anchor.

param.name: aPos
param.para: Enumeration element that indicates which anchor of the specified pWith range to compare to this range start anchor.

listheader.description: Compare this range start anchor with the specified range start anchor.
Compare this range start anchor with the specified range end anchor.

param.name: plResult
param.para: Pointer to the result of the comparison between this range start anchor and the specified pWith range anchor.

listheader.description: This start anchor is behind the anchor of the specified range (position of this start anchor < position of the anchor of the specified range).
This start anchor is at the same position as the anchor of the specified range.
This start anchor is ahead of the anchor of the specified range (position of this start anchor > position of the anchor of the specified range).

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.GetContext
member.summary: Obtains the context object to which the range belongs.
member.param: Pointer to an interface pointer that receives the context object that the range belongs to.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ITfRange.GetEmbedded
member.summary: The ITfRange.GetEmbedded method obtains content that corresponds to a TS_CHAR_EMBEDDED character in the text stream. The start anchor of the range of text is positioned just before the character of interest.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .

param.name: rguidService
param.para: Identifier that specifies how the embedded content is obtained.

listheader.description: Output should be an Accessible object.
Caller requires a direct pointer to the object that supports the interface specified by riid.
Content should be obtained as an data transfer object, with riid being IID_IDataObject. Clients should specify this option when a copy of the content is required.
Text services and context owners can define custom GUIDs.

member.param: UUID of the interface of the requested object.
Pointer to the object. It can be cast to match riid.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The implementing application does not expose embedded objects in its text stream.
The object does not support the requested interface.
The value in the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.
The start anchor of the range is not positioned before a TF_CHAR_EMBEDDED character.
The content cannot be returned to match rguidService.

member.name: ITfRange.GetFormattedText
member.summary: The ITfRange.GetFormattedText method obtains formatted content contained within a range of text. The content is packaged in an object that supports the interface.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Pointer to an IDataObject pointer that receives an object that contains the formatted content. The formatted content is obtained using a STGMEDIUM global memory handle.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The context owner does not support exporting formatted text as an IDataObject object.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.GetGravity
member.summary: Obtains the gravity of the anchors in the object.
member.param: Pointer to a value that receives the gravity of the start anchor.
Pointer to a TfGravity value that receives the gravity of the end anchor.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfRange.GetText
member.summary: The ITfRange.GetText method obtains the content covered by this range of text.
member.param: Edit cookie that identifies the edit context obtained from or .

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Bit fields that specify optional behavior.

listheader.description: Start anchor of the range is advanced to the position after the last character returned.
Method attempts to fill pchText with the maximum number of characters, instead of halting the copy at the position occupied by the end anchor of the range.

member.param: Pointer to a buffer to receive the text in the range.
Maximum size of the text buffer.
Pointer to a ULONG representing the number of characters written to the pchText text buffer.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.InsertEmbedded
member.summary: The ITfRange.InsertEmbedded method inserts an object at the location of the start anchor of the range of text.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Bit fields that specify how insertion should occur. If TF_IE_CORRECTION is set, the operation is a correction, so that other text services can preserve data associated with the original text.
Pointer to the data transfer object to be inserted.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The implementing application does not expose embedded objects in its stream.
The context owner rejected a default composition.
The context owner cannot handle the specified object type.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.
The caller already has an active composition, but the range is positioned over text not covered by the composition.
The document or the location of the range cannot be modified.

member.name: ITfRange.IsEmpty
member.summary: The ITfRange.IsEmpty method verifies that the range of text is empty because the start and end anchors occupy the same position.
member.param: Edit cookie that identifies the edit context. It is obtained from or .
Pointer to a Boolean value. TRUE indicates the range is empty; FALSE indicates the range is not empty.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie.

member.name: ITfRange.IsEqualEnd
member.summary: The method verifies that the end anchor of this range of text matches an anchor of another specified range.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Pointer to a specified range in which an anchor is to be compared to this range end anchor.

param.name: aPos
param.para: Enumeration element that indicates which anchor of the specified pWith range to compare with this range end anchor.

listheader.description: Compares this range end anchor with the specified range start anchor.
Compares this range end anchor with the specified range end anchor.

member.param: Pointer to a Boolean value. Upon return, TRUE indicates that the specified pWith range anchor matches this range end anchor. FALSE indicates otherwise.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.IsEqualStart
member.summary: The ITfRange.IsEqualStart method verifies that the start anchor of this range of text matches an anchor of another specified range.
member.param: Edit cookie obtained from or .
Pointer to a specified range in which an anchor is to be compared to this range start anchor.

param.name: aPos
param.para: Enumeration element that indicates which anchor of the specified pWith range to compare to this range start anchor.

listheader.description: Compares this range start anchor with the specified range start anchor.
Compares this range start anchor with the specified range end anchor.

member.param: Pointer to a Boolean value. Upon return, TRUE indicates that the specified pWith range anchor matches this range start anchor. FALSE indicates otherwise.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.SetGravity
member.summary: Sets the gravity of the anchors in the object.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context obtained from or .
Contains one of the values that specifies the gravity of the start anchor.
Contains one of the TfGravity values that specifies the gravity of the end anchor.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The cookie in ec is invalid.

member.name: ITfRange.SetText
member.summary: The ITfRange.SetText method replaces the content covered by the range of text. For an empty range object, the method results in an insertion at the location of the range. If the new content is an empty string (cch = 0), the method deletes the existing content within the range.
member.param: Identifies the edit context obtained from or .

Specifies optional behavior for correction of content. If set to the value of TF_ST_CORRECTION, then the operation is a correction of the existing content, not a creation of new content, and original text properties are preserved.
Pointer to a buffer that contains the text to replace the range contents.
Contains the number of characters in pchText.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The context owner rejected a default composition.
The value of the ec parameter is an invalid cookie, or the caller does not have a read/write lock.
The range is not within the active composition of the caller.

member.name: ITfRange.ShiftEnd
member.summary: Moves the end anchor of the range.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context. This is obtained from or .
Contains the number of characters that the end anchor is shifted. A negative value causes the anchor to move backward and a positive value causes the anchor to move forward.
Pointer to a LONG value that receives the number of characters the anchor shifted.
Pointer to a structure that contains conditions on the shift. This parameter is optional and can be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The edit context identified by ec does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.ShiftEndRegion
member.summary: Moves the end anchor into an adjacent region.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context obtained from or .
Contains one of the values that specify which adjacent region the end anchor is moved to.

Pointer to a BOOL value that receives a flag that indicates if the anchor is positioned adjacent to another region. Receives a nonzero value if the anchor is not adjacent to another region or zero otherwise.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The edit context identified by ec does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.ShiftEndToRange
member.summary: Moves the end anchor of this range to an anchor within another range.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context obtained from or .
Pointer to an interface that contains the anchor that the end anchor is moved to.
Contains one of the values that specify which anchor of pRange the end anchor will get moved to.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The edit context identified by ec does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.ShiftStart
member.summary: Moves the start anchor of the range.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context. This is obtained from or .
Contains the number of characters the start anchor is shifted. A negative value causes the anchor to move backward and a positive value causes the anchor to move forward.
Pointer to a LONG value that receives the number of characters the anchor was shifted.
Pointer to a structure that contains conditions about the shift. This parameter is optional and can be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The edit context identified by ec does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.ShiftStartRegion
member.summary: Moves the start anchor into an adjacent region.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context obtained from or .
Contains one of the values that specifies which adjacent region the start anchor is moved to.

Pointer to a BOOL that receives a flag that indicates if the anchor is positioned adjacent to another region. Receives a nonzero value if the anchor is not adjacent to another region or zero otherwise.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The edit context identified by ec does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange.ShiftStartToRange
member.summary: Moves the start anchor of this range to an anchor within another range.
member.param: Contains an edit cookie that identifies the edit context obtained from or .
Pointer to an interface that contains the anchor that the start anchor is moved to.
Contains one of the values that specifies which anchor of pRange the start anchor is moved to.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The edit context identified by ec does not have a read-only lock.

member.name: ITfRange
member.summary: The ITfRange interface is used by text services and applications to reference and manipulate text within a given context. The interface ID is IID_ITfRange.
